result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Sidney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Bail Refund Check Packet. DZ

Defendant Kenneth Sidney in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to 16CM002486; concurrent to any other sentence; with credit for 5 days time served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on Probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.
Conditions: 
*  Pay all costs and surcharges or, if not paid, convert to a civil judgment;
*  Maintain absolute sobriety;
*  Complete the Transformed Lives in Action program.  

Court waived the DNA sample and surcharge because it was ordered on case 16CM002486.  Court ordered bail on deposit to be returned to whomever posted.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Court orders the defendant removed from electronic monitoring and ordered to participate in and reside at the Transformed in Action program of the Milwaukee Victory Church.  All other conditions remain the same.  Case remains calendared for status conference on October 19, 2016 at 8:30 am in Branch 4.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court, defendant Kenneth Sidney not in court, in custody.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Filed, Motion to Modify Bail.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  Court grants defense motion to have the defendant released from the electronic monitoring conditions of bond.  All other conditions of bail remain the same.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court, defendant Kenneth Sidney not in court, in custody.  William P. Dockry appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  The defendant is in custody in Waukesha County.  Court waives the appearance of the defendant for this hearing only.  Defense counsel is waiting on the resolution of the Waukesha County case and a global offer on the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court, defendant Kenneth Sidney not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing date in about 60 days to allow additional time to sort some matters out.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2016 this case will be assigned to the Honorable Michael Hanrahan, Branch 4 in Room 515 of the Courthouse.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 4.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
No reply from defendant or surety. DZ

Attorney Joel H. Rosenthal in court, defendant Kenneth Sidney not in court, in custody.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defense received discovery today. Defense advises the court that the defendant also has pending matters in Waukesha County. Defense requested a modification of bail. Court DENIED modification request. Defense requested additional time to discuss matter with the defendant.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 21.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with ALL Pick N Save Stores

Defendant Kenneth Sidney in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Plaisted informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 23. Defendant Kenneth Sidney in court.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 45.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 45.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 7/9/15 @ 1:30 pm
